title: PHPelseKeyword

metadata.description: Learn about PHPelseKeyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Run some code when a condition is
not
met:
<?php
if (5 < 3) {
echo "Five is less than three";
} else {
echo "Five is not less than three";
}
?>

Definition and Usage
The
else
keyword specifies a block of code which should run when the condition of an if
statement is not met.
Related Pages
The
if
keyword.
The
elseif
keyword.
Read more about the if...elseif...else conditional in our
PHP if else Tutorial
.

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
<?php
if (5 < 3) {
echo "Five is less than three";
} else {
echo "Five is not less than three";
}
?>

practice_exercises.title: Complete the Code 1
practice_exercises.description: Fill in the missing line to make this code work.
practice_exercises.starter_code:
<?php
if (5 < 3) {
echo "Five is less than three";
} else {
echo "Five is not less than three";
}
# TODO: Complete this line
practice_exercises.solution:
<?php
if (5 < 3) {
echo "Five is less than three";
} else {
echo "Five is not less than three";
}
?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPelseKeyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPelseKeyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPelseKeyword and how to apply it in your projects.
